repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1558,10 +1576,21 @@ M.handlers.virtual_text = {
 
     local virt_text_ns = ns.user_data.virt_text_ns
     local buffer_line_diagnostics = diagnostic_lines(diagnostics)
+
     for line, line_diagnostics in pairs(buffer_line_diagnostics) do
       if severity then
         line_diagnostics = filter_by_severity(severity, line_diagnostics)
       end
+
+      if opts.severity_sort then
+        table.sort(line_diagnostics, function(a, b)
+          if type(opts.severity_sort) == 'table' and opts.severity_sort.reverse then
+            return a.severity < b.severity
+          end
+          return a.severity > b.severity
+        end)
+      end
+

comment_data.body: We should pull out the function from `handlers.signs` and call it `to_extmark_priority` or something, rather than defining this twice.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1478,6 +1478,24 @@ M.handlers.underline = {
     end
 
     local underline_ns = ns.user_data.underline_ns
+    local priority = vim.hl.priorities.diagnostics
+
+    --- @type fun(severity: integer): integer
+    local get_priority = function()
+      return priority
+    end
+    if opts.severity_sort then
+      if type(opts.severity_sort) == 'table' and opts.severity_sort.reverse then
+        get_priority = function(severity)
+          return priority + (severity - vim.diagnostic.severity.ERROR)
+        end
+      else
+        get_priority = function(severity)
+          return priority + (vim.diagnostic.severity.HINT - severity)
+        end
+      end
+    end

comment_data.body:
You're right, virtual text seems to be sorted already even without these changes, my bad.

Not sure how I didn't see this :sweat_smile:

comment_data.body:
I wrote these tests before realizing that I tried to fixed a working thing, should I remove them or leave it here? 

I think they are not useless
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1654,6 +1667,84 @@ describe('vim.diagnostic', function()
   end)
 
   describe('config()', function()
+    describe('severity_sort', function()
+      before_each(function()
+        exec_lua(function()
+          vim.diagnostic.config({
+            virtual_text = true,
+            underline = true,
+            severity_sort = true,
+          })
+
+          vim.diagnostic.set(_G.diagnostic_ns, _G.diagnostic_bufnr, {
+            _G.make_warning('Some Warning', 0, 0, 0, 0),
+            _G.make_error('Some Error', 0, 0, 0, 0),
+            _G.make_hint('Some Hint', 0, 0, 0, 0),
+          })
+        end)
+      end)
+
+      it('virt_text respects severity_sort reverse=false', function()
+        eq(
+          ' Some Error',
+          exec_lua(function()
+            local extmarks = _G.get_virt_text_extmarks(_G.diagnostic_ns)
+            local virt_text = extmarks[1][4].virt_text
+            return virt_text[5][1]
+          end)
+        )
+      end)
+
+      it('virt_text respects severity_sort reverse=true', function()
+        exec_lua(function()
+          vim.diagnostic.config({
+            severity_sort = { reverse = true },
+          })
+        end)
+
+        eq(
+          ' Some Hint',
+          exec_lua(function()
+            local extmarks = _G.get_virt_text_extmarks(_G.diagnostic_ns)
+            local virt_text = extmarks[1][4].virt_text
+            return virt_text[5][1]
+          end)
+        )
+      end)

comment_data.body:
Missing docstring `@param` for `priority`.

Also a small nit, but flip `priority` and `opts` so that `opts` is the last parameter (this is more consistent with other code).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -657,6 +657,28 @@ local function save_extmarks(namespace, bufnr)
     api.nvim_buf_get_extmarks(bufnr, namespace, 0, -1, { details = true })
 end
 
+---@param opts vim.diagnostic.OptsResolved
+---@return fun(severity: vim.diagnostic.Severity): integer
+local function create_extmark_priority_getter(opts, priority)

@@ -1478,6 +1485,9 @@ M.handlers.underline = {
     end
 
     local underline_ns = ns.user_data.underline_ns
+    local priority = vim.hl.priorities.diagnostics
+    local get_priority = create_extmark_priority_getter(opts, priority)

comment_data.body: We already have tests for severity sort https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/c8e47f648052f8001d8a493cf7ca6c4867a36bc3/test/functional/lua/diagnostic_spec.lua#L1802

@@ -1654,6 +1667,84 @@ describe('vim.diagnostic', function()
   end)
 
   describe('config()', function()
+    describe('severity_sort', function()
+      before_each(function()
+        exec_lua(function()
+          vim.diagnostic.config({
+            virtual_text = true,
+            underline = true,
+            severity_sort = true,
+          })
+
+          vim.diagnostic.set(_G.diagnostic_ns, _G.diagnostic_bufnr, {
+            _G.make_warning('Some Warning', 0, 0, 0, 0),
+            _G.make_error('Some Error', 0, 0, 0, 0),

+
+      it('virt_text respects severity_sort reverse=false', function()
+        eq(
+          ' Some Error',

+            local virt_text = extmarks[1][4].virt_text
+            return virt_text[5][1]

+        )
+      end)
+
+      it('virt_text respects severity_sort reverse=true', function()

+          vim.diagnostic.config({

+            local extmarks = _G.get_virt_text_extmarks(_G.diagnostic_ns)

comment_data.body:
> Also a small nit, but flip priority and opts so that opts is the last parameter (this is more consistent with other code).

:+1: 

> Missing docstring @param for priority.

Damn, there should be a lint rule for that :sweat_smile:
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -657,6 +657,28 @@ local function save_extmarks(namespace, bufnr)
     api.nvim_buf_get_extmarks(bufnr, namespace, 0, -1, { details = true })
 end
 
+---@param opts vim.diagnostic.OptsResolved
+---@return fun(severity: vim.diagnostic.Severity): integer
+local function create_extmark_priority_getter(opts, priority)

comment_data.body: Can you move this to the "allows sorting by severity" section?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1654,6 +1667,55 @@ describe('vim.diagnostic', function()
   end)
 
   describe('config()', function()
+    describe('underline severity_sort', function()
+      before_each(function()
+        exec_lua(function()
+          vim.diagnostic.config({
+            underline = true,
+            severity_sort = true,
+          })
+
+          vim.diagnostic.set(_G.diagnostic_ns, _G.diagnostic_bufnr, {
+            _G.make_warning('Some Warning', 0, 0, 0, 0),
+            _G.make_error('Some Error', 0, 0, 0, 0),
+            _G.make_hint('Some Hint', 0, 0, 0, 0),
+          })
+        end)
+      end)
+
+      it('underline respects severity_sort reverse=false', function()
+        eq(
+          'DiagnosticUnderlineError',
+          exec_lua(function()
+            local extmarks = _G.get_underline_extmarks(_G.diagnostic_ns)
+            table.sort(extmarks, function(a, b)
+              return a[4].priority > b[4].priority
+            end)
+            return extmarks[1][4].hl_group
+          end)
+        )
+      end)
+
+      it('underline respects severity_sort reverse=true', function()
+        exec_lua(function()
+          vim.diagnostic.config({
+            severity_sort = { reverse = true },
+          })
+        end)
+
+        eq(
+          'DiagnosticUnderlineHint',
+          exec_lua(function()
+            local extmarks = _G.get_underline_extmarks(_G.diagnostic_ns)
+            table.sort(extmarks, function(a, b)
+              return a[4].priority > b[4].priority
+            end)
+            return extmarks[1][4].hl_group
+          end)
+        )
+      end)
+    end)
+
